com.flir.flironesdk

Class SimulatedDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.flironesdk.Device
      • com.flir.flironesdk.FlirUsbDevice
        • com.flir.flironesdk.SimulatedDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SimulatedDevice
extends FlirUsbDevice
    A simulated device allows you to test your code without a physical device. All methods and behaviors will mimic a real device except for the following caveats:
    • MSX will be mis-aligned (this may be corrected in a future SDK release)
    • Temperature readings will be incorrect
    • Battery charge and discharge rates are much faster than a real device
    When simulating a battery discharge, the device will disconnect when the battery level reaches zero.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulatedDevice

        public SimulatedDevice(Device.Delegate delegate,
                       Context context,
                       java.io.InputStream sampleFramesZipData,
                       float initialBatteryPercentage)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructs a simulated device that can stream a frame loop provided in a zip file with connectSimulatedDevice.
        Parameters:
        sampleFramesZipData - should be an InputStream to a zip file of raw thermal and visible frame pairs, with file names of the format lep-00001 for thermal and vis-00001 for the visible. The SDK example application has a raw resource at R.raw.sampleframes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the sampleFramesFipData InputStream fails.
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Disconnects the simulated device. After calling this method you may connect to a physical device or a new simulated device.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • setChargeCableState

        public void setChargeCableState(boolean connected)
        Simulates the charging cable being plugged in or unplugged.
        Parameters:
        connected - The new state for the charging cable: false for being unplugged, true for being plugged in.
